required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Carbon Dioxide Acupulse Laser Treatment Versus Sham Treatment and Stress Urinary Incontinence Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-blind, Sham-controlled Clinical Trial for Evaluating the Efficacy of Fractional Carbon Dioxide Laser in the Treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence

brief_summary.textblock: The study is intended to assess the safety and efficacy of Carbon dioxide AcuPulse laser treatment in patients with stress urinary incontinence. Eligible subjects will be randomized to either receive 3 laser or 3 sham treatment sessions, 4 weeks apart and 3 follow up visits 3, 6 and 12 months following the last treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Following a screening visit, eligible subjects will be enrolled into the study. Subjects will be randomized into either laser treatment or sham treatment. Each subject will receive 3 treatments 4 weeks apart and 3 follow up visits, at 3, 6 and 12 months following the last treatment.
Further demographic information and patient history will be obtained from the subjects' electronic files.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment up to 12 months post treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment up to 12 months post treatment
From treatment up to 12 months post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in urinary distress index questionnaire scores

secondary_outcome.measure: International consultation on incontinence questionnaire-urinary incontinence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment up to 12 months post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in international consultation on incontinence questionnaire-urinary incontinence scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Pelvic organ prolapse/urinary incontinence sexual questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From treatment up to 12 months post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pelvic organ prolapse/urinary incontinence sexual questionnaire scores

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Negative urine analysis.
- Normal Pap smear test from the recent 3 years.
- No previous gynecological laser treatments.
- Able and willing to comply with the treatment/follow-up schedule and requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active genital infection.
- Subject presenting abnormal Pap result from the last three years.
- Recurring urinary tract infection or recurring infection of genital herpes or candida (> 2 episodes in the recent year).
- Transvaginal mesh implant.
- Serious systemic disease or any chronic condition that could interfere with study compliance.
- Any vaginal bleeding of unknown reason.
